intro: Bahiopsis chenopodina, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, spreading growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. It produces numerous tiny, pale green or yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Bahiopsis chenopodina is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
